results.title: The Very hungry caterpillar and other stories = The World of Eric Carle
results.creator_credit: Andrew Goff, Iain Harvey, Illuminated Film Company and Scholastic Productions
results.brief_description: Five animated stories from famous children’s author Eric Carle. In “The Very hungry caterpillar,” a caterpillar born on a Sunday eats a little more each day of the week but never seems to have his appetite satisfied. Until next Sunday that is, when he builds himself a cocoon. “Papa, please get the moon for me”: Before she goes to bed, little Monica looks out the window and spies the moon, longing to play with it, but try as she might, she can’t reach it, and asks her papa for help. “The Very quiet cricket”: A baby cricket struggles to answer the call of other insects; when he rubs his legs together there’s no sound. “The Mixed-up chameleon”: An unhappy chameleon, unsure of what he wants to be, seeks inspiration from creatures at the zoo. “I See a song”: A violinist plays notes that manifest themselves as a morphing array of colours, shapes and images. Stories narrated by Roger McGough and Juliet Stevenson. Music by Julian Nott.

results.title: The Very best of Peter Sellers
results.creator_credit: Robert Sidaway and MCEG Virgin Vision
results.brief_description: Everyone has a favourite moment from the many films of Peter Sellers. Reacall many moments from the classic Pink Panther films, where Sellers protrays his most celebrated character - that of the incompetent Inspector Clouseau. See rare footage and Goon-like antics with Spike Milligan. All these moments and many more, captured in almost one-hour of non-stop entertainment, showing the screen’s finest clown at his most brilliant and comic best.

results.title: The Very best of Fast Forward
results.brief_description: Comedy troupes come and go, but in Australia one conglomeration has had them rolling in the aisles longer than any other. The team of Fast Forward have become an institution in this country, making a television career out of sending up TV. The brilliant talents of the writers and comedians take the mickey out of the serials, the ads, the soap operas, the video clips - the things we see day in day out on the small screen. Relive such classics as Magda Szubanski in the Sorbent ads, Marg Downeys Jana Wendt, Michelle and Ferret, the Dodgy Brothers, Victor and Sveta (the Russian Newscasters), Bobby Batista (the visually-impaired American newscaster) and Gina Riley imitating a bunch of pop musicians in well-known video clips.

results.title: The Velveteen rabbit
results.creator_credit: Sudy Dostal and Leonard S. Berman
results.brief_description: This classic story based on the book, “The Velveteen Rabbit” by Margery Williams, is about nursery magic. We learn how a boy’s love and friendship transform a toy rabbit into a real bunny.

results.title: The Velveteen rabbit
results.creator_credit: Pierre Veck and Billy Budd Films
results.brief_description: A stop-frame animated version of Margery Williams classic children’s tale of a toy rabbit’s longing to become “real”. Through the love of a boy and a little nursery magic his dream comes true. Music from Vivaldi’s “Four Seasons”.

results.title: The Vanishing street
results.creator_credit: Robert Vas, BFI and Jewish Chronicle
results.brief_description: An intensive study of the Jewish comnmunity of the East End of London, in particular with Hessel Street, a centre of Jewry for the past 100 years which is now being pulled down and rebuilt as a slum clearance operation (1961-62). Poses the question: Will the close-knit nature of the community be able to survive under modern housing conditions in large blocks of impersonal flats.

results.title: The Vanishing (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: George Sluizer, Larry Brezner, Paul Schiff and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: After his girl friend mysteriously disappears at a petrol station, Jeff (Kiefer Sutherland) begins a year long quest to find her. Not even a new love (Nancy Travis), can distract him, and after much secrecy he is forced to bring her in on his quest. Unknown to Jeff, he himself is being stalked by the calculating psychopath (Jeff Bridges), responsible for kidnapping his girlfriend in the first place. Jeff and his new girlfriend are led on a chilling reenactment of the fate that occurred a year ago. Cast includes Kiefer Sutherland, Sandra Bullock, Nancy Travis, Park Overall and Maggie Linderman. This is a remake of director Sluizer’s 1988 Dutch version (302156).

results.title: The Vanishing
results.creator_credit: George Sluizer, Anne Lordon, Golden Egg Film and Ingrid Production
results.brief_description: Based on the story “The golden egg” by Tim Krabbe, “The vanishing” is an extraordinary and chilling study of obsession which investigates the edges of rationality and the destructive capacity of idealistic devotion.

results.title: The Vanished vikings. Part 1: Erik the Red
results.creator_credit: Edwin Morrisby, Gilbert Altschul Productions and Journal Films
results.brief_description: In 986 A.D. Erik the Red and his Vikings left Iceland and establish settlements in Greenland that were thought to be continuously occupied for 500 years before suddenly ceasing to exist. Traces Erik’s travels, using sagas as well as archaeological evidence. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Valley revisited
results.creator_credit: Movietonenews and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The Tennessee Valley Authority was the largest project undertaken by President Roosevelt’s Works Project Administration, transforming a malarial floodplain into a prosperous agricultural region and improving the living and working conditions for those who lived on the plain. President Kennedy’s vulnerability at his address when he visited the Project for the 30th anniversary celebrations on 18 May 1963 prefigured his assassination six months later.
